qas.question: The HDI has been criticized for focusing exclusively on what?
Has the HDI been criticized for being biased towards Western or towards Eastern models of development?
The HDI has been criticized for lack of what type of perspective on development?
Critics of the HDI cite its focus on which: egalitarianism or authoritarianism?
The HIDI has been criticized for focusing exclusively on what?
Has the HDI been criticized for being biased towards Northern or towards Southern models of development?
The HDI has been criticized for lack of what type of perspective on nondevelopment?
Critics of the HIDI cite its focus on which: egalitarianism or authoritarianism?

context: The Human Development Index has been criticized on a number of grounds including alleged ideological biases towards <a3_0><b7_0>egalitarianism<b7_0/><a3_0/> and so-called "<a1_0><b5_0>Western<b5_0/><a1_0/> models of development", failure to include any ecological considerations, lack of consideration of technological development or contributions to the human civilization, focusing exclusively on <a0_0><b4_0>national performance and ranking<b4_0/><a0_0/>, lack of attention to development from a <a2_0><b6_0>global<b6_0/><a2_0/> perspective, measurement error of the underlying statistics, and on the UNDP's changes in formula which can lead to severe misclassification in the categorisation of 'low', 'medium', 'high' or 'very high' human development countries.
